Psychosis: my neighbor has two heads now because he keeps whispering to himself in different places.
My reflection isn't right; it seems too pale or distorted sometimes.
I keep thinking about building a machine that can read minds. It feels urgent.
The floor tilts funny when I walk on it, like the whole house is moving slightly.
I feel watched constantly now, even though no one is around to see me doing it.
My pets won't go near their food sometimes and just stare at walls instead.
I hear whispers calling my name from outside during rainstorms.
Furniture rearranges itself when I'm not looking. Is that normal?
People's voices sound like distorted echoes unless they're very close to me.
I think my plants are judging me because their leaves keep changing position in sleep.
Sometimes I wake up thinking someone else is speaking with my voice. It's disorienting.
The walls seem to breathe different air when they're cold or hot from the sun.
I've been hearing these whispers in my head lately, like someone's talking about me when I'm reading the news, and it feels so real sometimes.
It started a few weeks ago actually. When I walk into a room alone, I swear I can see shadows moving at the edge of my vision for hours on end.
I keep mixing words now, especially when I try to remember names or places. Like 'clock' becomes 'cloud', and then somehow it's connected to 'falling'.
Sometimes I hear whispers at night, like voices talking about me even when no one's around.
I keep seeing shadows move on my walls, but they're just static in reality now.
People look strange to me lately; their faces seem... pixelated sometimes.
My thoughts jump all over the place without warning. One minute I'm happy, next I'm paranoid.
I think the government is watching everything I do because of my secret online activities.
Sometimes people say things that make no sense at all to me anymore.
Anxiety: I can't stop thinking about that presentation I bombed last week, it's exhausting.
My hands shake whenever I have to use the check-out line at stores. What is happening?
I keep checking my messages like maybe there's an emergency text from mom right now.
The noise in my head won't let me focus on anything productive today.
I feel this knot in my stomach all day, especially when I'm around crowds.
Since the storm last night, I've been terrified of hearing loud sounds alone at home.
What if everyone suddenly stopped trusting me? That thought keeps circling back.
My breathing feels tight sometimes; like it's hard to take a deep breath without hyperventilating.
I feel like other people can read my mind and know what I'm thinking about right now.
I just keep worrying that I'll make another mistake at work, even though nothing has happened yet.
Whenever I get in line somewhere, I start imagining all the worst-case scenarios for whatever comes next.
The way I pace back and forth under my desk might be obvious to others sometimes.
My shoulders ache constantly from tensing up without realizing it. Has anyone else noticed this?
I feel watched by someone while I'm sleeping, like an intruder in our home.
All the news feels overwhelming lately; there's too much uncertainty floating around out there.
When I go to parties, I immediately start planning my escape route before even talking to people.
My chest tightens up when I think about having to speak first at these group meetings.
I feel like everyone is judging me very harshly on social media right now. Social anxiety feels worse than ever.
This knot is in my stomach non-stop since I started this new job last week.
I keep replaying the meeting over and over in my head. What if I said something wrong?
My heart pounds so loud it feels like everyone can hear how scared I am.
It's hard to sleep because my mind runs wild with possibilities of disaster happening tomorrow.
I keep checking the locks three times because someone might break in while I'm asleep.
My chest feels so tight that it hurts when I breathe deeply.
Depression: I feel so empty most days; like nothing matters anymore. It's been weeks this way.
Every morning feels harder to get out of bed than the last since my dog passed away two months ago.
I can't seem to find any motivation for even simple tasks lately, it drains me completely.
This fatigue has just become part of my life now; I feel constantly tired no matter how much sleep I get.
I've lost all interest in hobbies that used to be so fulfilling. It's been months like this.
Sometimes I think everyone would be better off if I wasn't here anymore, it feels like truth sometimes.
I feel worthless and incompetent about everything I try doing right now. This feeling started last month after my job loss.
I can't eat much these days; food just doesn't seem appealing or satisfying at all.
This sense of hopelessness is crushing me when I think about the future, it feels permanent somehow.
Even small social interactions feel pointless and draining now. Has anyone else felt this way?
My mind feels foggy most hours of the day; nothing seems clear or interesting to focus on.
I haven't left my house in days because there's just no point. Everyone probably thinks I'm strange by now.
This persistent sadness has settled over everything, like a permanent grey filter since graduation last year.
My productivity at work fell off a cliff about three weeks ago and hasn't recovered yet.
I feel so alone right now; even though my family tries to visit or call me constantly. It's been months of feeling this way.
Everything feels monotonous and uneventful these days, like living in a dull movie for years.
I can barely muster the energy to shower some mornings because it all just seems too much effort.
I just don't feel anything anymore. Even happy news doesn't make me smile these days.
This lethargy has been dragging me down for almost two months straight now.
I can barely get out of bed before noon, and even then I stay in my room all day.
Everything feels pointless. Like there's no point to doing any chores or anything productive.
My appetite is completely gone since the holidays. Just don't have that drive anymore.
I feel worthless and stupid, like I'm making everyone around me miserable including myself.
Mania: I can't stop coming up with ideas for this new app! It's going to change everything we know about technology!
Working on my inventions keeps me so energized and focused that I don't need much sleep at all lately.
These strange, creative thoughts just keep popping into my head constantly; like a non-stop stream of brilliant insights!
I feel this incredible burst of energy every day now, especially when coding or brainstorming these wild concepts.
My mind is racing so fast with possibilities I can't even focus on one thing for long without excitement building.
This feeling that my ideas are going to revolutionize the world never leaves me; it's been weeks since this confidence started!
I haven't needed any sleep in days because everything feels so exciting and urgent at this moment!
These grandiose thoughts about our project feel completely real to me right now, like we're on the verge of something amazing!
My enthusiasm for every new thought is overwhelming; like I have boundless energy just from imagining potential solutions.
I keep thinking these ideas are so brilliant that everyone must agree with them immediately! It's exhausting being this correct.
I just feel so incredibly happy all the time lately! Like, it's like I've hit a jackpot and still got more money to spend.
Every single thing is going my way right now, honestly. And I mean that in the best possible way!
My mind won't stop buzzing with ideas; it feels like there are so many things happening at once, but they all make sense when I'm talking fast about them.
I can't even sleep properly these days because everything is just too exciting! Like last night, I was up until 4 AM planning this incredible trip we're going to take next month.
I feel so powerful right now that nothing seems impossible for me! Like, if I set my mind to something, anything can be done.
Sometimes I just laugh out of nowhere because suddenly everything is funny and brilliant at the same time.
I can solve world hunger if I had a team! Just need the right approach, maybe through tech?
Every idea just keeps popping into my head faster and clearer than ever before.
This energy is amazing! I could talk about anything all day long without tiring at all.
I've got so many brilliant concepts for mobile apps that fix everything. Why hasn't anyone thought of this?
It feels like the best time in history to start my own company and change things!
My mind races way too fast sometimes, but it's mostly creative energy right now.
I'm convinced we're all going to achieve something incredible if we just try harder today!
